discourse_list.title: Growth CU weekly update: October 1 - October 7

content.content: General Updates  Institutional Vaults. In a coordinated effort between different Core Units, we are close to the launch of the Nexo IV. It has been an exciting process that allowed us to work together with potential IV users and the Maker Community. These are our learnings of that process:  Governance reward tokens are very attractive for borrowers, not just because they directly reduce fees but also because the rewards are available capital for them. Although we can’t compete with that (for now at least), we offer increasing capital efficiency by predictable rates. The nature of the protocol (it’s not a pool, and everyone mints new Dai using their assets) is a huge difference from the other lending pools in the market. And an important advantage, because it’s easy to trace the origin of funds, and also the limit of Dai liquidity depends on the collaterals and not on the size of the pools. As more TradFi companies are interested in DeFi, new companies will want to try out the protocol, and we need more content to explain to these risk and compliance teams (not crypto teams) how Maker works. We have to check all the integration points these institutions use to access the protocol are working as expected. If not, they won’t be interested in using the protocol. As we mentioned before, there are some legal challenges with these TradFi companies. We are working on it, and we expect to give you updates on this matter soon. PSM as an on-off board solution for DAI is super powerful We have to keep improving IV terms and the process.  Thanks to everyone who contributed to this process!  Digital Asset Report → Talking about DAOs Here’s the video clip from @Jenn’s appearance on Digital Asset Report, a global broadcasting platform covering finance, tech, and crypto news. It was on the topic of DAOs for more mainstream audiences.   Star-s- of the week   Satang - a Thai exchange, listed DAI against THB fiat pair. Wax Blockchain is live with their -alpha version- of an ethereum bridge and is supporting Dai.  Tweet of the Week   twitter.com    MakerDAO Growth @MakerGrowth    1/18  Societe Generale – Forge, the digital-asset investment firm and subsidiary of @SocieteGenerale, has made a Collateral Onboarding Application to the Maker Community  We are here to celebrate this first-timer TradFi-DeFi milestone, but also to explain what does it really mean https://t.co/ha1gYzoo2a   3:46 PM - 5 Oct 2021           25                6             PnL September  image976×1050 135 KB

Nadia:   As more TradFi companies are interested in DeFi, new companies will want to try out the protocol, and we need more content to explain to these risk and compliance teams (not crypto teams) how Maker works. We have to check all the integration points these institutions use to access the protocol are working as expected. If not, they won’t be interested in using the protocol. As we mentioned before, there are some legal challenges with these TradFi companies. We are working on it, and we expect to give you updates on this matter soon.    Some super important points made here that the community cannot ignore, or forget about—TradeFi companies interested in DeFi! Can’t wait to hear—about a possible solution.

Nadia:  Wax Blockchain is live with their -alpha version- of an ethereum bridge and is supporting Dai.   WAX is undoubtedly a reference when it comes to buying and selling NFTs, I think that is its main purpose as a network, and it has many, many interesting games, what good news that DAI is coming to these places.

discourse_list.title: Growth CU weekly update: October 15 - October 28

content.content: General Updates  Institutional Vaults IV has been helping us to initiate conversations with companies with large crypto treasuries to explain to them what’s happening with Maker. It’s easy for them to not pay that much attention, and to get distracted by the rewards other protocols offer, and not be aware of the lowest stability fees and opportunities Maker has. One to one communication with our users has been an interesting process that allowed us to:   The objective with Nexo’s IV is to mint up to 1.5B DAI from ETH and wBTC, increasing the Dai backed by decentralized tokens. When we started conversations with them, Nexo had a 200m DAI position, and by today they have a 1.3B DAI position.   Celcius increased their position from a 38m DAI position to a 225m DAI position.   It is helping us to understand the challenges institutions have when interacting with Maker:     We discovered that Fireblocks for institutions was not working well with Oasis. Now we are working with the FB team and PECU to solve that problem.   We are having conversations with other institutional custodians so they can integrate maker vaults.   Although the Polygon -Matic- vault is not an IV, we knew the primary user for the vault was going to be the Polygon team. They have been having issues with the DC-IAM because of the efforts to coordinate their multi-sig signers to approve each transaction and then wait for the DC to increase. We also had a similar situation with the USDP PSM, in this case, the user didn’t understand how the DC-IAM worked.   We have been educating the compliance and legal team of those institutions on how is Maker different from a lending pool and the implications of being a DAO.    A strong Maker ecosystem Our strategy is to create long-term relationships with our partners. Because of that, we proposed to the community to add new stablecoins to the PSM after discussing how both teams (Maker and the stablecoin) could find benefits from that integration. Thanks to @Jenn  and @MarianoDP  for your work with the Gemini team!  LisCon and the Maker Mixer It was a blast to meet all the 64 Makers in Lisbon. There was a lot of networking between the Maker Fam (lots of new faces!!!), new ideas on how to improve what we do, collaborate better with each other, and grow the Maker fam.  1294×1096 216 KB  We had the Maker Mixer (Thanks to @Corina  for helping us to organize it!)  1600×1010 464 KB  @juan  and I participated as speakers in the LisCon event  image1040×328 40.8 KB  We talk about MIM+Maker with the frog nation (from DeFi to DeFi 2.0 )  1600×1096 371 KB  Party with the bests   1600×1045 417 KB  And talked about clean money (from Defi to Refi )  1600×960 316 KB   Events. We are organizing a side event during NFT NYC next week with Stablenode, Creaticles, Upshot and Chromia… registration is here:  twitter.com    The Mynt @themyntlab    You're invited! Please join us for the first #nftnyc event at The Mynt Gallery on Nov 2 presented by @MakerGrowth @StableNode @creaticles @Chromia @UpshotHQ - only 100 spots available RSVPs open ticketfairy.com/event/art-3-0/ https://t.co/K5EI4dE01A   3:19 PM - 27 Oct 2021           37                11

As usual this update is a joy to read      Nadia:  They have been having issues with the DC-IAM because of the efforts to coordinate their multi-sig signers to approve each transaction and then wait for the DC to increase.   If that is the reason and there is in fact no lack of goodwill on their end, finding a mitigation that ensures this doesn’t happen again while mostly maintaining the security brought by the DC-IAM sounds like a medium-high priority (I guess for PECU or Risk). It’s particularly sad when illegible, work-intensive layers of technical friction create bad outcomes.
Any way I could get ticket to Mynt?  It says sold out
Really awesome pics, guys. When we get out of lockdown, I’ll do a 35h flight to Lisboa

discourse_list.title: Growth CU weekly update: October 8 - October 14

content.content: General Updates  Welcome, @Corina  to the Growth team :). She is our Project Manager, and will help us organize all tasks behind the campaigns with our partners. Corina worked in B2B marketing and PR (mostly fintech) for around four years. She fell into the rabbit hole in 2020, when she joined thetokenizer.io as a business analyst, covering tokenization of RWA. She studied marketing management in college, and soon she will be finishing her bachelor’s degree in business, IT & digital transformation. At the moment, she’s writing her thesis on the DeFi and Web3 revolution . She has also been a community lead/advisor in her university’s student org for the past 2+ years (CBS Blockchain Society) - doing events, hackathons, etc., and providing educational resources to students about blockchain. Please give her a warm welcome  MV Index Solutions GmbH (MVIS®), in partnership with CryptoCompare, one of the leaders in digital asset data, announced the launch of the MVIS CryptoCompare Decentralized Finance Leaders Index (ticker: MVDFLE). The MVIS CryptoCompare Decentralized Finance Leaders Index (MVDFLE) is designed to track the performance of the largest and most liquid decentralized finance assets. It is an investable subset of MVIS CryptoCompare Decentralized Finance Index. The MVDFLE includes Maker as the no. three constituent ( after Uniswap and Aave ). Cryptopets, an upcoming AR game and collectibles project on Solana, gifted us a Dai branded pet inspired by the capybara.  image940×342 35.4 KB   Events. EthnBro: First ethereum community event in the Czech & Slovak markets occurred on Oct 9th. A presentation was given on Maker ecosystem, and the majority of VIP tickets were purchased using DAI. Will you be in Lisbon next week? If so:  Use this link to be part of the Maker Lisboa gang telegram group  Save the date of Oct 21st, from 6pm to 10pm for the “The Lisbon MakerDAO Mixer” (more details soon, check the telegram group)  Or maybe, you will be in NY for the NFT NY. We are preparing the NFT NYC Maker happy hour. We will provide more details closer to the event date.   Star-s- of the week   Bitrue - a Taiwan and SG registered exchange, listed DAI/USDT pair. Mexo Exchange integrated DAI. Mexo is one of the biggest exchanges in México, with over +100k users from all LATAM. They listed the pair DAI/USDT and more to come in the future. Lemon Cash App listed DAI  Now their users can buy Dai with ARS and get benefits from all the features that Lemon Cash App enables, such as APY of 13%, deposits from BSC and Mainnet, and a 5 DAI Bonus to the first 500 DAI users within the App. Anchorage will integrate the vote delegation feature by the end of this month (eta).  Tweet of the Week   twitter.com    MakerDAO Growth @MakerGrowth    And with this, over 7 Billion $DAI are out in the wild 🌎🪙 twitter.com/MakerDaiBot/st…   Maker DAI Bot @MakerDaiBot  Vault #8463 (ETH-A) was used to generate DAI: ️️🖨️ 95,300,000 DAI minted 📉 Liquidation price: $1,478.69 💳 Vault debt: 592,998,134 DAI 🐋 🏦 Total DAI Supply: 7,013.835M DAI  https://t.co/6HSvGQfQaf    3:50 PM - 14 Oct 2021           27                5

Nadia:  Cryptopets , an upcoming AR game and collectibles project on Solana, gifted us a Dai branded pet inspired by the capybara.   Super cool — good to see your team making strides in the Solana ecosystem! And welcome onboard @Corina Question—with the new initiative for “Clean Money” I was wondering if you had sort-of thought about initiatives towards such—like what Celo and Curve Labs is doing here: Introducing the Celo Climate Collective | by Celo Foundation | The Celo Blog | Oct, 2021 | Medium

Nadia:  Cryptopets , an upcoming AR game and collectibles project on Solana, gifted us a Dai branded pet inspired by the capybara.   The Chigüire will soon be the mascot of the Maker protocol, everything is aligned in favour of the Chigüire.

yes!!! we have some ideas, but we don’t want to execute any of them before (1) the community and maker holders decide that’s the direction we want to take, and (2)we think we need to develop a clear narrative around the clean money initiative, that helps us to define the message, and also the actions that will go along with it. Btw thanks for sharing the celo initiative
